ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I came to learn a lot more about quantum mechanics and the application of mathematics to the physical sciences. As someone who came in having done a lot of chemistry, it was pretty cool to see how many chemical principles that we take for granted are direct results of quantum mechanics.
I learned the basics of quantum mechanics and reached a level of knowledge in other areas that will allow me to continue on my own after the class.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Course was good - went at an suitably challenging pace and problem sets greatly facilitated learning by allowing us to put into practice what we had learnt in class.

Although it was a fast paced course the problem sets and the reading quizzes provided a way of checking if we were developing a good understanding of the material. The distribution of time between the chapters also reflected the amount of material and was helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Anyone who is at all curious about quantum mechanics should take this course. It isn't easy, but the effort is well worth it.

I would recommend this course to any student who is interested in gaining a good introduction to quantum mechanics. It provides a good base of knowledge by itself and would also lead well to the study of further subjects. It is a fast paced, but a very well taught course.
